body_html:
I'd argue to keeping this set_shape() and in the future renaming it. I am concerned about portraying the idea that this is equivalent to the idea of numpy shape... i.e.
foo = np.array([[1,2,3],[4,5,6]])
foo.shpae = (6,)
is equivalent to foo = np.reshape(foo, (6,))
Though in TensorFlow this doesn't work, and probably would require returning a new op rather than changing all instances in place.
@yifeif and @martinwicke might have views as well.

@yifeif and @martinwicke might have views as well.
body:
I'd argue to keeping this set_shape() and in the future renaming it. I am concerned about portraying the idea that this is equivalent to the idea of numpy shape... i.e.
foo = np.array([[1,2,3],[4,5,6]])
foo.shpae = (6,)
is equivalent to  foo = np.reshape(foo, (6,))
Though in TensorFlow this doesn't work, and probably would require returning a new op rather than changing all instances in place.
@yifeif and @martinwicke might have views as well.
